mercury.name: mercury
mercury.desc: The smallest and fastest planet, Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and whips around it every 88 Earth days.

venus.name: venus
venus.desc: Spinning in the opposite direction to most planets, Venus is the hottest planet, and one of the brightest objects in the sky.

earth.name: earth
earth.desc: The place we call home, Earth is the third rock from the sun and the only planet with known life on it - and lots of it too!

mars.name: mars
mars.desc: The red planet is dusty, cold world with a thin atmosphere and is home to four NASA robots.

jupiter.name: jupiter
jupiter.desc: Jupiter is a massive planet, twice the size of all other planets combined, and has a centuries-old storm that is bigger than Earth.

saturn.name: saturn
saturn.desc: The most recognizable planet with a system of icy rings, Saturn is a very unique and interesting planet.

uranus.name: uranus
uranus.desc: Uranus has a very unique rotation--it spins on its side at an almost 90-degree angle, unlike other planets.

neptune.name: neptune
neptune.desc: Neptune is now the most distant planet and is a cold and dark world nearly 3 billion miles from the Sun.
